# Camera Overview

### **Undo Latch on camera to open it like a book.**

**Overall Camera Layout**

1.  **LCD Screen**
    1.  Display Camera Settings
2.  **POWER/ MODE SWITCH**
    1.  Turn Camera **ON/OFF** and allows user to access **SETUP MODE**
3.  **SWITCHEd**
    1.  Navigate and program camera settings
4.  **SD Card Slot**
    -   Make sure SD card is not locked
    -   Insert SD card with label facing upwards
    -   A click sound indicates SD card is inserted correctly
    -   To remove
        -   gently push and the card should spring back and then it can be removed
5.  **Battery Compartment**
    -   Put **8 AA** batteries
    -   Line Up **Negative/Positive** symbols on camera to **Negative/Positive** on batteries

![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/000.01-Bushnell%20Overview.jpeg)

### **Buttons**

1.  **POWER/ MODE SWITCH**

    1.  **ON** = Power switch in the **ON** position (LCD screen is off.)
    2.  **SETUP** = SETUP mode: Power switch at SETUP position (LCD screen is on).
        -   Check and Change the settings of the camera
    3.  **OFF** = OFF mode: Power switch in the OFF position

2.  **MENU**

    -   Pressing MENU allows you to select any parameter and change its settings.

3.  **OK**

    -   save the new setting

4.  Arrow Keys

    1.  **RIGHT/LEFT**

        -   Scrolls to the next or previous parameters

    2.  **UP/DOWN**

        -   Select a different setting for the currently displayed parameter

![Bushnell Model A Keys](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/000.01-Bushnell%20Overview.jpeg)

![Bushnell Model B Keys](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/000.2-Other%20Bushnell.jpeg)

### **Screen**

1.  **Mode Camera**
    -   **Camera symbol** means camera in camera mode
2.  **Image Resolution**
    -   Should be **HD**
3.  **SD Card**
    -   Clear if **SD card** is **not locked**
    -   If **SD card** is **locked** a lock symbol will appear in center
4.  **Battery Level**
5.  **Date/Time**
6.  **Remaining Photo Capacity**
    -   Total number of photos SD card can hold
7.  **\# of Photos Taken**
    -   Number of photos on SD card
8.  **Field Scan ON**
    -   Will appear if Field Scan is ON.

    -   Blank if Field Scan is OFF
9.  **Time Stamp ON**
    1.  Will appear if Time Stamp is ON
    2.  Blank of Time Stamp is OFF

![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/BUSHNELL%20Home%20Screen.jpeg)

# Power Camera On

1.  Put **8 AA Batteries** into the **Battery Compartment**
    1.  Refer to **Camera Overview** section , subsection 2 , subsection 5 ( **Battery Compartment** )
2.  Install **SD CARD**
    1.  Refer to **Camera Overview** section , subsection 2 , subsection 4 ( **SD Card Slot** )
3.  Move **POWER/MODE SWITCH** switch to **SETUP** position
    1.  SETUP position brings up the set up mode screen
4.  LCD Screen should turn on

![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Bushnell%20Camera%20Turn%20to%20SetUP.jpeg)

# Downloading a Camera

1.  Arrive at Camera

2.  Unlock Pad Lock and remove camera from housing ( remove if you can )

3.  Open Camera

    -   **POWER/MODE SWITCH** Should be **ON**
    -   Take Photo of it (Like the one pictured below), even if it is **OFF**
        -   The photo will allow user to both confirm it was on and if the SD card had no images it was a SD card or camera malfunction.

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Camera%20On.jpeg)

4.  Move **POWER/MODE SWITCH** to **OFF**

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Bushnell%20Camera%20Initial%20Off.jpeg)

5.  Remove **SD Card**

    1.  Refer to **Camera Overview** section , subsection 2 , subsection 4 ( **SD Card Slot** )

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Bushnell%20Camera%20Remove%20SD.jpeg)

6.  Insert **Blank SD Card**

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Bushnell%20Camera%20Insert%20SD.jpeg)

7.  Move **POWER/MODE SWITCH** to **SETUP**

    -   LCD Screen Will Turn ON.
    -   IF LCD Screen does not turn ON.
        -   Move Power Switch to **OFF**
        -   **Replace Batteries**

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Bushnell%20Camera%20Turn%20to%20SetUP.jpeg)

8.  **Check Time**

    1.  Take photo exactly like one below.
    2.  If time differs change it.
    3.  Follow from **MENU** sections use sub section **1.** to **Set Clock** to adjust time
    4.  This camera was 2 min ahead so had to subtract 2 min

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Camera%20Not%20Adjusted.jpeg)

9.  **Check other Settings**

    1.  **Camera Mode**
    2.  **Field Scan On**
    3.  **Battery Level**
        -   If 1/3 change batteries
    4.  **SD Card Unlocked**
    5.  If settings are good take a photo exactly like the one below.

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Settings%20Check.jpeg)

10. **Deploy Camera**

    1.  Move Power Switch to ON

    2.  Take Photo exactly like on below.

        -   The photo will allow the user to confirm that the camera is on when they are not at camera

    ![](Documents/CameraSOP/Bushnell/Photos/Camera%20On.jpeg)

11. **Put Camera Back in Housing and have a nice day**
